subject: RE: [junit] JUnit test design for conversion between EBCDIC and A SCII for AS/400.
msgSnippet: Pankaj I know nothing about AS/400, so this may or may not apply. Assuming you have a conversion object (EBCDIC - ASCII or vice versa), you could do something
messageBody:
Pankaj

I know nothing about AS/400, so this may or may not apply.

Assuming you have a conversion object (EBCDIC -> ASCII or vice versa), you
could do something like the following:

public void testConvertBytes(){
EbcdicToAscii ebcdic2ascii = EbcdicToAscii.getInstance();

int[] temp = {0xC1, 0xC2, 0xC3}; // "ABC" in EBCDIC
assert("Result should be ABC", new
String(ebcdic2ascii.convert(byteArrayFromInts(temp))).equals("ABC"));
}
private byte[] byteArrayFromInts(int values[]) {
byte[] result = new byte[values.length];

// copy input integer array to our new array, cast to bytes
for (int i = 0; i < values.length; i++){
result[i] = (byte) values[i];
}

return result;
}

HTH.
-Jason
-----Original Message-----
From: Pankaj Solanki [mailto:psolanki@...]
Sent: Thursday, September 06, 2001 9:55 AM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [junit] JUnit test design for conversion between EBCDIC and ASCII
for AS/400.


Hi,

Whether anybody knows how to write test cases and test script for conversion
of EBCDIC to ASCII and ASCII to EBCDIC for AS/400 using JUnit3.7 tool ?

Plz pass the information to me.

Thanks,

Pankaj
